the meaning of this 36th verse is
O Saunaka, thereafter the Lord, having bade farewell to King Yudhishthira, Draupadi and other relatives, started for the city of Dwaraka, accompanied by Arjuna and other members of the Yadu dynasty.
So, we have to understand the importance of engaging qualified brahmanas to perform a Vedic sacrifice.
So, elsewhere Srila Prabhupada explains, to perform a sacrifice successfully, at least four expert priests are required.
Who are the four expert priests who should be present for successfully executing a sacrifice?
One who can offer, is called Hota. One who can chant, Utgata. One who can kindle the sacrificial fire without the aid of separate fire, Advaryu. And one who can supervise, Brahma.
So, Hota, Utgata.
Advaryu, Brahma. Four kinds of priests are required for performing a Vedic sacrifice.
Such sacrifices were conducted from the birth of Brahma, the first living creature, and were carried on till the reign of Maharaja Yudhishthira.
But, such expert brahmana priests are very rare in this age of corruption in India.
And therefore, in the present age, only the Yagna of chanting the holy name of the Lord is recommended.
The scriptures enjoin, Hare Nama Hare Nama Hare Namaiva Kevalam Kalau Nastyeva Nastyeva Nastyeva Gathiranyatha.
So, in Kali Yuga, only the Sankirtan Yagna is recommended.
And to chant the Hare Krishna Mantra does not require previous qualification.
Another place, Prabhupada says that once Krishna had gone with some covered boys.
Krishna and Balarama had gone with some covered boys.
Early morning, taking the calves for grazing.
And the boys, after some time, became very, very hungry.
So, they told Krishna, please arrange for some foodstuff.
Krishna then told the boys that nearby this place, wherever they were, there are some brahmanas who are performing a Vedic sacrifice.
So, Krishna told the boys, go to those brahmanas and ask for some charity, some dana.
Then those covered boys went to those brahmanas and approached them with folded hands and fell down to the ground to offer them respect.
So, what did the covered boys say?
They addressed the brahmanas and they said,
O earthly gods, kindly hear us.
Who are ordered by Lord Krishna and Lord Balarama.
We hope you know them both very well.
And we wish you all good fortune.
Krishna and Balarama are tending cows nearby.
And we have accompanied them.
We have come to ask for some food from you.
You are all brahmanas.
You are knowers of religious principles.
And if you think that you should give us charity, then give us some food.
And we shall all eat along with Krishna and Balarama.
The boys continued to speak to those brahmanas.
You are the most respectable brahmanas within the human society.
And you are expected to know all the principles of religious procedure.
So, this is what the boys said to those brahmanas.
Now, Srila Prabhupada explains,
Although the boys were village boys and were not expected to be learned in the Vedic principles of religion,
they hinted that because of their association with Krishna and Balarama,
they knew all those principles.
If you associate with Krishna or his pure devotee,
then automatically you are able to get enlightenment simply by performing devotional service
in understanding all the religious principles,
especially those which are meant to enliven us, enlighten us,
without separate endeavour at studying or doing some other practice.
Simply by association with the right people, you become enlightened, you become enlivened.
Now, these boys, covered boys, because they were associating with Krishna and Balarama,
they expressed the point of view that when the supreme personality of Godhead Krishna and Balarama were asking for food,
the brahmana should immediately deliver some without hesitation.
